answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some guidelines and resources that may be helpful.
Here are some areas that have government owned and operated shelters. They do not have much listed about their policies but you may have luck contacting them independently for more information.
    1-Fredrick County, VA: http://www.co.frederick.va.us/public_works/animal_shelter/default.aspx
    2- Amelia County, VA
http://www.pets911.com/organizations/AMELIAAS/org_homepage.php
    3-Boone County, IL
http://www.boonecountyil.org/department/bcac
I have also included the National Animal Control Association’s guidelines for “Personnel Training and Safety” At Kennels.
www.nacanet.org/guidelines/Guidelines%20Minimum%20Kennel%20Staffing%20Needs.pdf 
The ASPCA’s guidelines to shelters to maximize safety and wellness might be a good resource too. This link also includes educational webinars.
http://www.aspcapro.org/webinar-series-guidelines-for-standards.php
For some of the highest standards in animal care I included the links to the guidelines from the American Animal Hospital Association and the Association of Zoos and Aquariums. The AAHA is something they might want to consider later on in the process because access to their information requires a membership.
http://www.aahanet.org/accreditation/index.aspx
http://www.aza.org/uploadedFiles/Accreditation/Accreditation%20Standards.pdf
I hope these offer some help.
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is considering opening its own animal control center and breaking way from the Humane Society.   Please forward any guidelines, policies, procedures that support a city owned/operated Animal Control Center.
Your time and expertise is appreciated!
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Voice
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
title: Starting City Operated Animal Control
